website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive vise for the garage workshop that’s perfect for smaller jobs. DIYers may need to rig a shim or bushing to hold the swivel bolt securely.
pros: Buyers like its utility and price
Included diagram makes mounting measurements easy
Clamps precisely enough to crimp wires
cons: Multiple reports of “slop” in the swivel pivot bolt, making it hard to tighten the vise
Metric bolts required to mount vise to your workbench
Some reports of breakage at the jaw
Unit is smaller than some expected

customer_reviews.title: Diapointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this vice for my son. Worked great till it broke one day after my Amazon return window closed, 31 days. Live and learn
customer_reviews.author: LMS

customer_reviews.title: Whatever you do don't use it as a vice it won't work
customer_reviews.text: Great vice until you try to use it like one!!! Donely thing you can expect from advice is to tighten down and things you wanted to hold well I don't consider myself to be overly strong but just with my hands cranking down on this device I snapped the jar right off of it I am completely shocked I thought this was going to be a good little vice
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Cracked in the first hour of use.
customer_reviews.text: The piece of junk cracked while flattening some aluminum tubing on the anvil. Ended up buying a 15 pound anvil for $12 at Harbor Freight and will stick with my carpenters vise to hold things.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased October 20th 2016... It lasted two months before it broke... And I didn't even apply much pressure!
customer_reviews.author: GlennC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gun-smithing and light home imporvement work.
customer_reviews.text: Solid build and easily installed. I put it at the end of my work bench and it has already helped me immensley on one AR build and ready to be used for upgrades and help friends. The swivel really comes in handy, and everything is solid if you tighten to a stop.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun A. Whitehorse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small AR-15 gun-smithing vice!
customer_reviews.text: My AR-15 bench vise setup. I don't have a garage so I have to make things work and this little vice gets the job done! No problem at all holding the AR-15 to remove the barrel nut, receiver extension castle nut or the muzzle break with this awesome inexpensive vice.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money on this. The center guide bar is weak making jaw alignment askew when tightening onto an object. The center bar bends so that the jaws are wide at the object being clamped and narrow at the empty side of the vice. So it works best if you put the object dead center of the vice. But even then this vice could only be classified as weak and sloppy at best. I wish I could get a refund and appology from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky D.

customer_reviews.title: Broke when i took out of box and tried to ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke when i took out of box and tried to open it. Labeled with Yost but very low quality. Think it was knock off junk.
customer_reviews.author: Shane greff

customer_reviews.title: OUCH!!
customer_reviews.text: Design flaw, part under turning bolt is square, so you hit your knuckles on it all the time (OUCH). Should have rounded that part off!!!! Stupid Engineer who designed this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Just added another Vice/vise to my crazy life!
customer_reviews.text: I like to smash things with hammers, I like to squeeze things until they pop and this vise lets me do all and more. Today I used it to hold a lawnmower blade while I pretended to know how to sharpen it properly #dudestuff I actually can feel the testosterone flowing through my veins like a wild Horse running free. When my wife asks what I am doing, I simply say "Baby I am doing some serious work right now"!!! In all truthfulness I am watching sparks shoot from my angle grinder off this mower blade like a 4th of july sparkler. Good Times! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Anton LoG

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this product, for the price this is a great value. It is very sturdy and has worked perfectly so far. I needed a vice to work on firearms as well as other random tasks but didn’t want to break the bank. This has been rock solid. Will be a very versatile tool to have in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: S. Warkocki

customer_reviews.title: It isn't sturdy enough for a home do it your self
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this vise it broke within the first month in a half I had it!!!! It isn't sturdy enough for a home do it your self, work on cars kinda person only prob good for small home house projects I guess poor quality for anyone that likes cars quads etc ....
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what it appears to be... a sturdy, inexpensive vice for everyday duty. It holds its workpiece well and is easy to bolt to a table or bench. If you need bigger jaws, or industrial-grade, pay more, but for the money exactly what I needed: A vice to hold my golf clubs as I re-gripped. With an (also available on Amazon) additional magnetized/plastic insert to hold the tubular shafts, this was the perfect tool.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Clawson

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I can say negative about this vice is that when you mount it right up to the edge of your workbench the bite does not clear the edge of the mounting surface... So if you're working on a long item, You will not be able to work on it vertically because the mounting surface will be in the way. But other than that it's a very sturdy vise and it does what it's supposed to. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jedi-J

customer_reviews.title: Bought july 10 , 2017, 7 months later, borked
customer_reviews.text: Put only a half a cheeks worth of ass in to it trying to put the squeeze on a pipe and blonk, the jack screw snapped and i poo’d a little.. welded it back together, codder pined it in across like it was and about a week later im cleaning another pair of pants... Spend the chooch and get the chach or maybe this is a knock off... is garbage to me
customer_reviews.author: Z Ack

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Initial impressions were passive as I installed on work bench as a replacement for a vise I’ve used 30+ years and the vice grips were worn out. First time I used this vice was when I inserted a “shepherds staff bird holder which a bear had bent. As I applied a little pressure to straighten, the vice broke into....completely ruined and useless. VERY POOR QUALITY. I did not return for refund but now wish I had. My old vice has now been reinstalled on bench with new grips and will likely endure for many years. This new one is of poor material even though it looks good. BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: John G. Linthicum

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This works great for what it's designed for. I used it to help with sharpening a lawn mower blade in which this vise made it easier to help with holding the blade. The only complaint I can think of while writing this review was that it wasn't supplied with any sort of mounting hardware but that's okay as I figured out what I needed, purchased some from a local hardware store and installed/mounted this vise with ease! I don't use this on a daily/weekly basis as some people may need to but for my intended using purposes this works just fine!
customer_reviews.author: J. Edwards, Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great light/medium duty vice
customer_reviews.text: Great little workhorse. I bolted this to my workbench and have no real complaints because of the price point. Got on lightning deal for $18. The base swivels so you can get it to virtually any position you need to get your work done. I have used this along with a pair of pliers to unscrew a hose that had decided to corrode and meld itself to the sprayer head. Very useful tool. I don't know how I lived without it. I find new uses for it every week. I would definitely recommend this for any light / medium duty jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All you need for gunsmithing
customer_reviews.text: I got this for light gunsmithing work and it works very well for that purpose. It's just small enough I can mount it to a quick change plate system I use with my reloading press so I can change them out based off my tasks for the day. But, it's solid enough I've built multiple ar15s and glocks with it without any issues. Just goes to show you dont need a beheamoth of a vise to do 95% of gunsmithing work
customer_reviews.author: medieval1226

customer_reviews.title: suprised
customer_reviews.text: I attached this to my portable bench and hoped like hell it would hold up to the hammering and cranking of a rifle barrel removal. it held up beautifully. The tightening bar could afford to be a little bigger, I felt like I couldn't get a good purchase on it with my big dumb hands- but it worked out. its a very well balanced vice- I didn't feel like I was going to break it which was my main concern considering I had the jaws as wide open as they would go for this project and amidst the hammering and torqueing, it held up fine. a good value if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: sillyghillie

customer_reviews.title: Decent Light Duty Vise
customer_reviews.text: Others have outlined the pros/cons of this vice - no need to repeat. Mine arrived with a sloppy pivot as described in various reviews. A quick wrap with Gorilla tape solved the problem. Not a permanent fix (a homemade bushing/sleeve would be far better) but good enough for my intended use. At <$20 USD delivered the product met my modest expectations. Would pass on anything over $30-35 as home improvement stores stock similar (arguably identical) offerings at the same price point.
customer_reviews.author: DB126

customer_reviews.title: I always wanted & needed a bench vise. GET THIS! Small but mighty!
customer_reviews.text: I can think of hundreds of projects over the last 15 years where I wished I had a bench vise. I made do with "vise grip" pliers and jury-rigging things. I recently started sharpening my mower blades and there is no way to do it safely without a bench vise. I ordered this little beauty, and I've used it dozens of times for all kinds of projects. Easy install, rotates to where I need it, and it's super-strong. I've hammered bend rods straight when clamped into my vise, and no issues whatsoever. Stop waiting and order this. You'll be glad you did!
customer_reviews.author: FireMedic

customer_reviews.title: A good budget option
customer_reviews.text: Hefty and suits it’s purpose. It’s hard to be mad at imperfections when you’re obviously shopping at a price point where expecting anything else makes you a ridiculous person. The fit and finish is a tad rough compared to what you’d see in higher priced units, but the next level up is twice the price. Having compared those to this, I don’t think they’re twice as good. Unless you need something with a larger jaw span, ultra tight tolarances, or a workbench showpiece, this is going to meet most DIYers needs just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D McClane

customer_reviews.title: Nice little Jaws
customer_reviews.text: This seems very sturdy and clamps without wobbly and looseness that some comes with. It is a small vice for like hobby jobs n such so don't expect it to take a sledge hammer to it. The jaws are perfect for small parts and projects.however I would suggest getting some plastic and search between the Jaws if you're going to work with anything that could be marred by the metal Jaws
customer_reviews.author: jared haulk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for portable or smaller work bench.
customer_reviews.text: This vise is perfect for my small work bench. I have already put it through some projects and it performs great. Sharpening my lawn mower blade was 10 times easier with the sturdy grip of this vise. The pipe holder feature of the LV-4 came in handy when cutting EMT pipe for my landscape electrical project. This vise is smaller than what I am use to, but for the projects I do around the house, it is perfect. Best purchase I made yet for my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this product broke the first use. Not doing anything heavy duty, just used it to hold a small pipe that I was trying to thread. Cracked about 20 seconds in, as others have stated. Maybe it's nice for holding stuff up straight to paint, or can be used as a clamp, but it's definitely not capable of acting like a vice...the metal is poorly cast and filled with air gaps, leading to immediate fractures
customer_reviews.author: Andruszko

customer_reviews.title: Use lightly
customer_reviews.text: It worked great until I really USED it like a vice. Clamped a mower blade in it and tried to straighten it with a big wrench (pipe wrench) and the back side of the vice snapped off. Made of cheap cast. I'll weld it back together for light work but get a larger heavier one made in USA. Great for the price
customer_reviews.author: Craig Granchi

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality vice!
customer_reviews.text: I am a homeowner who does DIY projects. This vice was of a really great quality for my purposes. Shipping was pretty fast, but package was partially opened when I received the package (probably due to how heavy the vice is), but there was no damage to the vice.
customer_reviews.author: MtnJan

customer_reviews.title: Impressively sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if they fixed the issues others were reporting or if I just got lucky but there's zero play in the unit I got. The mini anvil is great for fine work and the vise mounted solidly to my work table. I routinely saw through hard metal (turning old files into knives) and I'd definitely notice if there was jittering as it would throw off my cuts. Solid build and excellent value for price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Decent vise for Light/Moderate Bench Work
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this purchase. Tight lock-up on the adjustments and jaws. It is suitable for my light bench work and gun bench, so I am happy. Didn't have the lock-up problems others have described. All-in-all, it is a good value. Don't know if it is Taiwan ROC made or the other one, but figure it is probably the latter; regret that.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer! ️ ☺️
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love it! I sharpen knives. And holds lots of things for me while using the grinder. I've used it for a bending metal, all sorts of projects. Best purchase I've made in a while! I wanted to add this is a light-duty vise is not for heavy duty jobs I'm a Crafter and I do some woodworking if you're going to be bending some steel and things like that by the vices for that type of job. This is a home use vise inexpensive and very handy for extra hands.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Boggs

customer_reviews.title: Amazed with this
customer_reviews.text: I ended up putting an L bracket on it to bend. Honestly the L bracket bent more because the vice was holding it so good. This thing was cheap and well worth the money to anyone needing a vice. I could see this for working on guns as well if I ever have to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Latham

customer_reviews.title: Great vise for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good size for what I need it for. Just working on my AR's and things. Great price as well. Is nice that is swivles around easy as well so when I am working on things I can move it to get a better angle.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: I was installing a lunch box locker in my Heep and needed a vice to remove the ring gear from the carrier. I bought this little fella and it was ok. It seems solid but it didn't quite hold (swivel in base of the vice) and I had to hold the vice as I wrenched out the bolts. It worked, but if you are looking for something to last or you use it frequently I would say buy one that's a bit beefier.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Slippyfist

customer_reviews.title: Great vise.
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed vise. Literally only one complaint and it won’t bother most buyers. The color doesn’t match the photo. The one I received is a very dull gray blue. Otherwise it a functioning vise. I just need to replace mine and the blue in the photo matches my workshop equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: You can't toss in a few bolts to anchor this thing? Come on guys.
customer_reviews.text: This is an OK vise. Don't rely on it for anything that requires super precise work, but for most of what you need held in one place, it'll get the job done. Seems like they have mostly fixed the wobble to it. But jeez, guys, you couldn't throw in a few bolts and nuts to anchor this thing down? I have to make a separate trip to the hardware store to mount this thing to a work bench? That's the equivalent of selling a toy without the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: chrisazonian

customer_reviews.title: Tight, solid vise!
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews complain that the vice isn't tight. Due to this, I was concerned at first as mine wasn't either until locking it's rotating position. Once this was done it was VERY tight and did not wobble at all Seems like a solid vise and I'm looking forward to getting some use out of it!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D Solanes

customer_reviews.title: Works for my needs
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, even when everything is locked down, if you torque hard enough (like tightening a bolt on whatever you have clamped down) you can feel the the main pivot bolt slop. I haven't taken it apart to fix b/c it's not that big of a deal for what I'm working with, but be aware that if you buy one, you'll have to jury rig your own solution if it bothers you. Besides that, it's heavy and works well. The anvil part is too small to be useful. A nice feature is the pipe clamp underneath the main vice jaws.
customer_reviews.author: Dan A.

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I need good not great
customer_reviews.text: Works great for gunsmithing and other small tasks. I wouldn’t wrench down on it too hard though. It doesn’t seem the most hardy of vises but will work for the small jobs I need it for. Cheap and just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bench vise!
customer_reviews.text: I'm still trying to understand how so many people claim this vise is "light duty" or "flimsy". Are you guys hitting it with a jackhammer? It's super well made and put together for the price you pay. Yeah, it's not a 2000 dollar Wilton vise but it's a 28 dollar vise, which I think is an incredible value for what you're getting. If you are in the market for a standard use bench vise, this thing is fantastic. Pull the trigger and buy immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: this product is a well built vice it's not ment for heavy duty use, im exploring the usability for ar15 hoppy it seems like it's working well no problems holds strong and is easy to use fit & finesh is what one should expect it's nicely painted looks good opens up fine and closes fine like i said it holds strong i expect this vice to profom great for its intended purpose (ar15 building).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little vice!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and quickly installed on my workbench in about 10 minutes. It's a very nice little vice for the price. Sometimes, you just need another pair of hands and this fills the bill. Overall, very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just for holding chainsaws for me
customer_reviews.text: First off if the pictures come out upside down and backwards or sideways...that’s amazons BAD I loaded them correctly the program flipped them or turned them sorry about that I wrote an email to amazon for them to fix that. Anyways the vise is cool I took it to a welder and had him make me a stand. I’m only using it to hold my chainsaws while I sharpen them. That’s all I’m using the vise for and it works well for that
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great small Vise For the Money 💵
customer_reviews.text: Awesome small vise for the money 💴, not quite big as I thought but it’ll work for small jobs I need it for . Price was right . 👌🏻 I would recommend this for those with small vise in mind .
customer_reviews.author: Jimnic26

customer_reviews.title: Great Product great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for AR builds to use with custom vise blocks. I am honestly shocked how great this is for the price. You definitely need to bolt it down due to its size but it works great for my needs. I highly recommend for small jobs or gunsmith work.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W.

customer_reviews.title: Fine for Homeowner / Hobbiest
customer_reviews.text: OK for the $26 shipped price whats not to like? It swivels 240 degrees has 4.5" wide jaws, opens 3" however the fixed jaw does NOT extend far enough to clear or be past a a bench. For my "hobby" bench it's perfectly fine But I surely wouldn't have it in my garage shop - that vice has to be 360 degree swivel, inner jaw must overhang the bench / mounting flange and is well over triple this ones cost. w/Prime received next day!!!!!!!! WOW
customer_reviews.author: Busted Knuckle

customer_reviews.title: Great AR Lower Build Vise
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to build AR-15 lower receivers and attaching flash hiders to a couple barrels and so far it is perfect for that. I also got a pair of the plastic magnetic covers that sit on the clamping surfaces. I am not sure how this would hold up to serious abuse but for gun smithing its just about perfect. Only thing that I do not like about it is that the piece where the handle is located is too long and will get your fingers if you are not careful It got me twice so far, won't get me again.
customer_reviews.author: The Fly

customer_reviews.title: Great Vise
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a 4.5" vise then this is it. I must say It exceeded my expectations. Let me start by saying it is really sturdy and has a strong grip as good or better than an expensive vise. For first time buyers the vise is a must have tool, it's easy and there's many use for it. Back to the Yolt lv4 The price here on Amazon is phenomenal if you take into account how a 3.5" or 4” vise goes for more at a regular store.
customer_reviews.author: Arnaldo Caraballo

customer_reviews.title: Shop perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and handy right away. Tip: I had some flat magnet strips and cut them to length if the vise jaws and they hold to the vise teeth themselves for a smooth clamping surface when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need fulfilled
customer_reviews.text: The Yost Bench LV-4 Vice is going to be great. Installed easily on my workbench and with the rotating capability I'll be able to work projects from 270 degrees. If the anvil had a rounded surface it would be a 7 Star.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Cats

customer_reviews.title: Nice light-weight and light-duty bench vise
customer_reviews.text: Seems decent for light duty work. So far I have used it to bend some over the door hangers to fit my door width, which worked well. Swivels on base to change jaw position. Light weight, which I needed for my folding bench.
customer_reviews.author: Leadfoot

customer_reviews.title: Great light use vise
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this vise for light work in a home workshop. For the price it is great. I don't know if I'd put a ton of torking on it; it is what I call a "hobby" vise. As of now, can't think of anything bad about it; sure there are better stronger ones, but you pay a lot for those.
customer_reviews.author: Tophat101

customer_reviews.title: Good value, no wobble on mine , slight mismeasurement in item
customer_reviews.text: Good value in a vise. I have no real complaints except a small one having to do with the listed throat depth being inaccurate. Although the depth is listed as 2 5/8" on the box, which by the way should be included in the item description for ANY vise Amazon, it is actually just barely at 2 1/4-2 5/16. This matters if you need clearance of a certain depth below the top of the jaws. Other than that it's a great value and mine does not have the wobble that has been mentioned here and adjusted for. Maybe Yost has fixed this issue themselves now.
customer_reviews.author: mmamazon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent affordable Vise!
customer_reviews.text: On the durability/features vs price front this vise is hard to beat! I have it mounted on my bench and for what it does (flat clamping, > 270 degree horizontal rotation, it even has a small indentation under the clamp to grip pipes of about <2" in diameter) it is excellent. I have used it for all sorts of projects and couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: A. Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This vise works great. I haven’t had an issue with the pivot being loose, but I generally use it for cleaning my pew pews, so I’m not exerting a lot of force.
customer_reviews.author: mick04u

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, clean, well made vise
customer_reviews.text: The castings are real clean, well detailed. I wanted a vise for occasional use, don't need a huge one, didn't want to spend a whole lot. This was real reasonable and it's a real quality product. I studied a bunch and Yost all look very well made. This one proves that out. Look forward to using it.
customer_reviews.author: Neeko the Greeko

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent quality
customer_reviews.text: Lets just be clear, this is a LIGHT duty vice. Its not particularly beefy and its uses are as advertised, a home use vice. I am assuming that many of the buyers of this product are using it to assemble AR uppers or lowers, which it seems quite suited to. But don't buy this to swap the springs on your struts from your car, it won't hold up to heavy duty use. Pretty decent quality. The swivel bushing issue is real, and it is inexplicable why a bushing isn't installed to stop this issue. Be prepared to McGuyver something to compensate for this issue. Overall not bad, but limited. But for $25 what can one expect?
customer_reviews.author: Grp Cpt Mandrake

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was alittle concerned the vice was going to have some play in it after Reading the reviews. Mine works PERFECTLY. Now obviously there is alittle play when it’s adjustment screw is loose but when I tighten it down it’s solid! Works great on my work bench.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Westmoreland

customer_reviews.title: Excellent vise for the hobbyists, not so much for a professional shop
customer_reviews.text: The only downside to this vise is that I’ll have to buy a bushing for it to make the swivel lockdown work reliably. I’m happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ron hargis

customer_reviews.title: High carbon brittle iron.
customer_reviews.text: Arrive with a broken base. Cost more to send it back than to get a refund. The high carbon iron use in te manufacture of this unit makes it brittle and can crack easily.
customer_reviews.author: Eugenio Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little vise for the money
customer_reviews.text: They fixed the sloppy base for the shoulder bolt. Although the shoulder bolt was loose. I tightened it down and put some locktite on it. Excellent little vise for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Scott P.

customer_reviews.title: A good mid sized vise
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I decided to buy the Yost LV4 inspite of some complaints about the sloppiness of the center bolt. Well, the observations were accurate, but the solution was easy thanks to a reviewers great solution which he was kind enough to show by a photo. I had some aluminum flashing, that I trimmed to about 3/8 of an inch wide and then molded it around the circumference of the bolt that was not threaded. End of problem. At the time of purchase the cost on Amazon was $22. Two days later they are listing it for $40. Talk about luck. One for the good guys.
customer_reviews.author: Peter R.

customer_reviews.title: Holds what I need we’ll!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for holding those small/med things while your drilling or cutting. Quality product. Holds well. Works for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Shmity

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little vice
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what I needed it for: holding woodwork while I carve. Anyone looking for a cheap set up to do the same, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Value in small size
customer_reviews.text: I read some reviews of it's durability. First thing I did was try to tighten it as much as I could and nothing cracked. I'm not using the anvil portion it's to small for any use. The size is deceiving it's no where near the size of a 4 1/2 vice you see in stores. It's definitely smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo and Natalie Franch

customer_reviews.title: Good Value!
customer_reviews.text: Worked to build at least 1 AR-15. Can't beat it for the price. I'm sure there's way better vises out there but I can't complain about this one. I'll update this review if it ever fails on me.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Hard to open and close
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for a few days now. The clamp doesn’t screw in and out very easily. I’m not sure if something got tweaked or what, but it isn’t as smooth as before.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Arrived shattered, not confidence inspiring!
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived in an undamaged box and marked inspected. The vice clamps were shattered and cracked. Apart from being completely useless everything else looks fine.
